title: Challenge-Based Learning Program for Senior-Friendly Social Innovation

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational social science and project management experience
context.additional_context: Customized training for practicing professionals, focusing on blended learning environments for developing practical solutions to address aging society challenges

learning_goals: Learners can apply design thinking techniques for analyzing elderly needs to generate three or more creative ideas.
Learners can develop a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) that solves social issues using a challenge-based learning framework.
Learners can collaborate in multidisciplinary teams to create and present an executable plan for an elderly-friendly social innovation project, passing evaluation.

Learners can utilize the five core entrepreneurial competencies (motivation, opportunity recognition, perseverance, resource leveraging, collaboration) required in social innovation as self-assessment criteria.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
